summary:
Cholesterol is a sterol found in all higher animals, especially in the brain and animal fats. It's made by our cells and is important for our body, helping to build cell membranes and produce vitamin D and hormones. Most of it is made in our liver.

Too much cholesterol, especially the "bad" kind (LDL), can increase the risk of heart disease. Fran√ßois Poulletier de la Salle first discovered cholesterol in 1769 in gallstones.
title: Cholesterol
